statement.para: Any two bases of a nonzero subvector space V of \RNr[n] have the same number of vectors.

proof.para:
The key ingredient in this proof is the fact that, if V can be spanned by m vectors, then any linearly independent subset of V
has at most m vectors
Look up this fact.
.

Now suppose \EuScript{B} and \EuScript{C} are bases of V, containing exactly r and s vectors, respectively. Then we have r\leq s, because \EuScript{B} is a linearly independent subset contained in the span of \EuScript{C}. Moreover, we have that s\leq r, because \EuScript{C} is a linearly independent subset contained in the span of \EuScript{B}. Thus r=s, and the theorem is proven.
